Degrees

Oct, 2018 — May, 2022

Institute for Theoretical Physics (LUH), Hannover

I got my PhD in Theoretical Physics from LUH under the supervision of Olaf Lechtenfeld with generous support from DAAD. My thesis "Solutions of Yang–Mills theory in 4 dimensional de Sitter space" is based on classical gauge theory.

Jul, 2015 — May, 2018

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata

I graduated from IISER-K with a Masters degree in Physics of the Integrated PhD program of the Deparment of Physical Sciences. This 3-year intensive training was greatly beneficial with course-works from Physics & Mathematics departments.

Jul, 2010 — May, 2015

Indian Institute of Technology (BHU), Varanasi

I have Bachelor & Master of Technology degrees, obtained through the 5 year dual-degree program of the Department of Biochemical Engineering at IIT-BHU. I developed & nurtured my interest in theoretical physics during this phase.

Teaching

Institute for Theoretical Physics, Leibniz University Hannover

  1. At the end of summer semester, 2020 I conducted another intensive revision course (lectures+excercises) on Introduction to Quantum Theory.

  2. I conducted an intensive 1-week revision course (lectures+excercises) on Mathematical Methods of Physics at the end of winter semester, 2019-20.

  3. I assisted (exercises+2 lectures) the Lie groups, Algebra and their Representations course by my supervisor, Olaf Lechtenfeld, during summer semester, 2019.

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata

  1. I assisted (assignments) the Advanced Mathematical Methods of Physics course by Sunandan Gangopadhyay during autumn semester, 2017.

  2. I assisted (excercises+assignments) the Intermediate Electricity and Magnetism course by Ananda Dasgupta during spring semester, 2017.

Scholarships

I am grateful to the following scholarships/fellowships for facilitating my academic journey.

I was awarded the prestigious doctoral fellowship of Deutscher Academischer Austaushdienst (DAAD) in 2018 for a period of 4 years through a screening process that involved submitting a research proposal followed by a personal interview.

In 2016 I secured the Junior Research Fellowship of the Council for Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) after qualifying the national eligibility test (NET), that funded me during Oct, 2016 – May, 2018 at IISER-K.

I was in the Super-30 program (for intensive IIT-JEE preparation) of 2009-10, where I was selected through competetive entrance examinations. It's founder, Anand Kumar, is a mathematician with remarkable teaching ability and is very well known.

I was part of an IIT-JEE coaching program arranged by Dakshana foundation (a non-profit organisation) at Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Ranchi during 2008-09 and was selected through a competetive entrance examination.
